articles.title: Multi-Ontology Integration with Dual-Axis Propagation for Medical Concept Representation

By using large language models, LINKO allows for dual-axis knowledge propagation, integrating information from multiple ontology systems simultaneously. Its significance lies in its ability to improve predictions, especially in cases with limited data or rare diseases.
why_it_matters: Healthcare professionals could benefit from more accurate medical data interpretations, leading to better patient care.

The practical implication is that EHR systems could become more effective tools for healthcare providers.
lenses.engineer: Technically, LINKO employs a dual-axis approach for knowledge propagation, enhancing concept representation learning across multiple ontology graphs. It uses large language models to initialize concept embeddings and performs vertical and horizontal propagation within and across hierarchical levels. Extensive experiments demonstrate LINKO's superior performance compared to existing models, particularly in scenarios with sparse data and rare disease predictions.

articles.optimized_headline: Unlocking LLM Potential: How Cognitive Scaffolding Transforms Instructional Strategies
articles.speedrun: Researchers have introduced a new method to enhance how large language models (LLMs) handle instructional dialogue. They developed a symbolic scaffolding mechanism combined with a short-term memory schema, leading to improved reasoning in tutoring scenarios.
